div.p: Group 1 Mapping from https://index.hcisolutions.ch/index/current/get.aspx?schema=CODE&keytype=CDTYP&key=26 (CHEMEDEPRHCIIndexCdTyp26NamingSystem) to EDQM - Standard Terms

tr.td: The source code is, specifically, an intravesical injection.
The source code is, specifically, an intravesical instillation.
The source code is, specifically, oral use by means of chewing.
The source code is, specifically, epidural use by means of infusion. EDQM states defines the epidural use code as "Injection of a medicinal product into the epidural space.".
The source code is, specifically, endotracheal use. Note that EDQM requires this to be by means of an instillation and inhalations are excluded.
The source code is, specifically, endotracheal use by means of an instillation.
The source code is, specifically, extracorporeal use by means of an injection.
The source code is, specifically, extrapleural use by means of infusion.
The source code is, specifically, oropharyngeal use by means of gargles.
The source code is, specifically, gingival use by means of injection.
The source code is, specifically, gastro-intestinal use by means of instillation.
The source code is, specifically, intraarterial use by means of infusion.
The source code is, specifically, intraarterial use by means of injection.
The source code is, specifically, an intraduodenal instillation, while the target code is any intestinal use (duodenum, jejunum, ileum and colon).
The source code is, specifically, intragastric use by means of an instillation, while the target code is any gastric use.
The source code is, specifically, intragrandular use by means of an injection, while the target code is any gastric use.
The source code is, specifically, intralesional use by means of injection.
The source code is, specifically, intraocular use by means of injection.
The source code is, specifically, intraocular use by means of instillation.
The source code is, specifically, intraosseus use by means of injection.
The source code is, specifically, intraportal use by means of infusion.
The source code is, specifically, intraportal use by means of injection.
The source code is, specifically, intrathecal use by means of infusion.
The source code is, specifically, intrathecal use by means of injection.
The source code is, specifically, intrauterine use by means of insertion.
The source code is, specifically, intrauterine use by means of injection.
The source code is, specifically, intravenous use by means of infusion.
No match is available. Arguably, the EDQM code 20062000 (Route of administration not applicable) could be used.
The source code is, specifically, intravitreal use by means of injection.
The source code is, specifically, nasal use by means of instillation.

EDQM excludes nasal inhalation intended to target the lower respiratory tract (which should be inhalation use instead). Assuming that these are normaly oral and not nasal, it could be safe enough to use this mapping to nasal use for these cases.
The source code is, specifically, oromucosal use by means of spraying a medicinal product.
The source code is, specifically, oropharyngeal use by means of spraying a medicinal product.
The source code is, specifically, auricular use by means of instillation.
The source code is, specifically, perineural use by means of infusion.
The source code is, specifically, perineural use by means of injection.
The source code is, specifically, retrobulbar use by means of injection.
The source code is, specifically, a subcutaneous use by means of injection.
The source code is, specifically, a subcutaneous implantation.
The source code is, specifically, a subcutaneous use by means of infusion.
The source code is, specifically, subretinal use by means of injection.
The source code is, specifically, oromucosal use by means of sucking a medicinal product.
The source code is, specifically, urethral use by means of injection.
The source code is, specifically, urethral use by means of instillation.

description.value: Mapping from HCI CdTyp26 route of administration codes to RouteOfAdministrationEDQM codes.

purpose.value:
This concept map provides guidance for implementers that use HCI Index product(s) internally to translate codes for routes of administration to the eMedication service value set RouteOfAdministrationEDQM (defined as part of CH TERM).
This concept map does not - and could not possibly - provide a one to one match for every source code. Whenever possible, comments in this concept map provide further guidance on how to approach the translation of problematic items.
